intro: Echites guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil echites, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it an attractive species for ornamental purposes.
